2337610402436211198.Text: Thirsk is the name of this mead hall. It was built over five hundred years ago by a group of Nords who left the Skaal Village. They were led by Hrothmund the Red, who became Thirsk's first chieftain.

26517204677349422.Text: Thirsk is the finest mead hall you'll ever visit, friend. It lies north of here, to the east of Lake Fjalding. If you reach the Skaal Village, you've gone too far. When you get there, see Ulfrun. She's in charge of the mead, and will gladly sell you a flagon or three.

44942989523296714.Text: *burp* Thirshk? You're shtandin' in it, shilly! *burp*

32520159461436823166.Text: Nordic place, right? North of here? Inconsequential. You have more important things to worry about.

29698239631190529130.Text: From what I understand, it's some sort of place the Nords gather. Northeast of here, I think. But it's my belief that the native cultures here are best left alone. We wouldn't want to stir anything up.

2070729790870024050.Text: Thirsk is just to the east of Lake Fjalding. It's a mead hall that was built by a group of Skaal who split from our village hundreds of years ago. They no longer follow our ways, but we've no quarrel with them.

3202619198204196340.Text: I have heard it is a place populated by the Nords native to this island. It lies somewhere to the northeast.

2096914830280511788.Text: One of those Nord places, isn't it? You won't catch me anywhere near there. I think it's up to the northeast someplace.

317785758231729897.Text: Thirsk is a mead hall. It's just to the east of Lake Fjalding.
